extendedIngredients.name: tart shells
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 packages (1.9 ounces each) frozen miniature phyllo tart shells

recipes.title: Phyllo Crab Cups

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Vampire Pinot Grigio Wine. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: Vampire Pinot Grigio Wine
productMatches.description: This dry, zestful combination is reminiscent of ripe pears and roses

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a small bowl, beat cream cheese and horseradish until smooth. Stir in crab and onion. Spoon 2-3 teaspoonfuls into each tart shell; sprinkle with paprika.                                                                                            Place on a baking sheet. Bake at 350° for 16-18 minutes or until tops begin to brown.                                        Yield: 2-1/2 dozen.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Phyllo Crab Cups in  Taste of HomeApril/May 2006, p56                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1 each) equals 45 calories, 3 g fat (2 g saturated fat), 10 mg cholesterol, 55 mg sodium, 2 g carbohydrate, trace fiber, 1 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a small bowl, beat cream cheese and horseradish until smooth. Stir in crab and onion. Spoon 2-3 teaspoonfuls into each tart shell; sprinkle with paprika.
Bake at 350° for 16-18 minutes or until tops begin to brown.
